Title: P.E. / Project Manager
Description: BIO: Tim Mitchell has been with Civil & Environmental Consultants, Inc. since interning with them in 2006. In his time there, he has been involved with various solid waste management projects including residual and municipal waste landfill design, permitting and construction; transfer station design and permitting; and general engineering support for waste facilities. He was born and raised in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. He received a bachelor of science degree in civil engineering from the University of Pittsburgh in 2006. He received a master of science degree also from the University of Pittsburgh in 2011. He is a professional engineer registered in the state of Pennsylvania. Also, he is the Vice Director for SWANA's Landfill Management Technical Division.

Title: Assistant Administrator for the Office of Land and Emergency Management
Description:
BIO: Mathy Stanislaus was nominated by President Barack Obama for the position of Assistant Administrator in EPA's Office of Land and Emergency Management (OLEM) on March 31, 2009, and began in his service on June 8, 2009, after confirmation by the U.S. Senate.
As Assistant Administrator for OLEM, he leads EPAâ€™s programs that revitalizes communities through the cleanup and redevelopment of contaminated sites under Superfund, Brownfields and Resources Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) programs, oversees other federal agencies cleanup of contaminated properties and advances hazardous and solid waste materials management under RCRA, chemical plant safety, oil spill prevention, underground storage tank program, and emergency response. He regularly testifies in Congress regarding aspects of these programs, including rules and budget. Â 
His official EPA bio can be found at http://www.epa.gov/aboutepa/mathy-stanislaus-assistant-administrator-office-land-and-emergency-managementÂ 
Â

Title: Owner
Description:
BIO:

Matthew Cotton is the owner of Integrated Waste Management Consulting, LLC (Nevada City, California). He has more than 30 years of experience in solid waste management planning, permitting, policy, regulatory compliance and composting. He has worked as a consultant, educator, researcher and advocate for new and expanded organics recycling and composting programs in California and beyond. In more than 30 years of work, Matt has completed hundreds of significant solid waste projects, including permitting and assisting in the development of some of the major composting facilities in California. His company serves public, private and institutional clients. Matt has served on the U.S. Composting Council Board of Directors since 1999 and was elected president of the Board in 2006, 2007 and 2008. He also serves on the Board of Directors of Californians Against Waste. He has published research on compost odors, compost use, climate impacts, compostable plastics and compost facility infrastructure. He also teaches compost facility operator training and related courses for the U.S. Composting Council, SWANA, the California Resource Recovery Association and others.

Title: Senior Vice President
Description: BIO: Patrick Sullivan has degree from Harvard University and over 26 years of experience in solid waste consulting. He is a Senior Vice President and Managing Director for SCSâ€™s Consulting and Engineering Operations in the Southwestern U.S. He is the Principal-in-Charge for air quality, greenhouse gas, landfill gas, and renewable energy projects for solid waste facilities. Pat is the Vice Director of the SWANA LFG/Biogas Division. He has published over 100 technical papers in industry publications and presented at over 50 conferences, including those sponsored by SWANA, NW&RA, EREF, USCC, and A&WMA.

Title: Federal Public Affairs Director
Description: BIO: Susan Robinson is public affairs director for Waste Management. She has worked in the environmental industry for 30 years in roles that span the public sector, non-profit, consultancy, and more than 20 years in the private sector. Her experience includes global commodity marketing, research and analysis of industry trends and 20 years managing municipal solid waste and recycling contracts. Susan has worked for Waste Management since 1999, with much of her time interfacing with local governments and implementing new municipal programs. She currently works with Waste Managementâ€™s recycling, innovative technology and fleet teams, supporting the companyâ€™s transformation from disposal to a materials management company. She is responsible for the companyâ€™s public policy efforts to support this transition. Susan is on the Board of Directors of Ameripen and the American Biogas Council, served on the Washington State Governorâ€™s Beyond Waste Working Group and is past president of the Washington State Recycling Association. She attended Stanford University and the University of Washington and holds degrees in applied earth sciences and English. Her Masterâ€™s degree work in environmental studies is from the Evergreen State College.

Title: President and CEO
Description: BIO: Dr. Bryan Staley currently serves as president and CEO of the Environmental Research and Education Foundation. Â He joined the EREF four years ago, where he started as vice-president of environmental programs, and has 18 years Â of experience in the environmental engineering field. Â He is a technical expert in sustainable solid waste management issues and obtained a Ph.D. in solid waste research at North Carolina State University. Â He also is Â a licensed professional engineer. Dr. Staley has held key positions in consulting firms as a project manager and vice-president of engineering, where he managed projects ranging from solid waste management, wastewater treatment system design, to retail/commercial land development and large-scale livestock operations.

Title: Corporate Director of Landfill Operations
Description: BIO: Jay Warzinski has 30 years of experience in landfill construction, management and compliance. He has held his current role since 2013 and is responsible for providing technical support and direction for landfill operations and development projects including all landfill gas and landfill gas-to-energy projects for the companyâ€™s 39 active landfills. He assists in planning for capital expenditure projects including liner construction, closure construction, gas system permitting and construction, infrastructure, borrow development and major permitting. He also manages environmental compliance and coordinates environmental due diligence process of potential acquisitions. Prior to joining Advanced Disposal, Jay served as senior regional engineer for Veolia Environmental Services Solid Waste, Inc. Jay holds a Bachelorâ€™s degree in civil engineering from Marquette University and is a Certified Landfill Manager in Wisconsin and Missouri.

Title: Deputy Director
Company: Office of Resource Conservation and Recovery
Description: BIO: Kathleen Salyer is the deputy director of the Office of Resource Conservation and Recovery within the Office of Land and Emergency Management at the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), a position she has held since January 2015. The office is responsible for promoting resource conservation through sustainable materials management, ensuring safe management of solid and hazardous waste and cleaning up environmental contamination at hazardous waste management facilities. Prior to her current position, Kathleen was an assistant director of the Superfund Program in U.S .EPA Region 9 in San Francisco. She has more than 18 years of experience cleaning up contaminated sites. Kathleen has a Bachelorâ€™s degree in geology from Whitman College and a Masterâ€™s degree in environmental public policy from University of Maryland, College Park.

Title: Sustainability Strategy Manager
Description: BIO: Mark Yamauchi leads the efforts to incorporate sustainability into all aspects of the Real Estate and Facilities Department and heads up strategic initiatives crossing inter- and intra-departmental organizations that focus on sustainability and operational efficiencies. He was responsible for implementing the program that brought Toyotaâ€™s sales and distribution national headquarters campus to zero-waste-to-landfill status This program has been recognized by being awarded California Integrated Waste Management Boardâ€™s 2006 Waste Reduction Awards Program WRAP of The Year and 2007 Governorâ€™s Environmental and Economic Leadership Award. Mark also provided technical assistance to the Yellowstone National Park team that achieved Gold LEED certification for the new Old Faithful Visitorâ€™s Education Center. Most recently, he was responsible for the implementation of the stationary hydrogen fuel cell project at Toyotaâ€™s headquarters campus. This 1.11 MW direct hydrogen peaking shaving fuel cell is the first of its kind in the world to be fed directly from a hydrogen pipeline. He now is working to shape sustainability integration for the development of the new Toyota North American Headquarters in Plano, Texas. With more than 25 years of experience in real estate and facilities and a LEED Accredited Professional since 2002, he has provided advice on sustainability to many organizations including non-profits, major corporations, and governments on the municipal, national and international level Mark also sits on the Advisory Boards of the UCLA Engineering Extension global sustainability and recycling and MSW management programs.

Title: Senior Vice President
Description: BIO: Patrick Sullivan has degree from Harvard University and more than 26 years of experience in solid waste consulting. He is a senior vice president and managing director for SCSâ€™s Consulting and Engineering Operations in the Southwestern U.S. He is the principal-in-charge for air quality, greenhouse gas, landfill gas and renewable energy projects for solid waste facilities. Pat is the vice director of the SWANA LFG and /Biogas Technical Division He has published more than 100 technical papers in industry publications and presented at more than 50 conferences, including those sponsored by SWANA, NW&RA, EREF, USCC and A&WMA.

Title: Senior Director of Air Programs
Description: BIO: Amy Banister has more than 20 years of experience in air quality consulting, project management, regulation development and planning, as well as corporate environmental program implementation. She is responsible for directing air program activities at Waste Management, which includes developing corporate policies and standards and training programs for application at Waste Management North American facilities. Amy also is responsible for corporate climate change reporting and participates in regulatory advocacy for air issues pertaining to Waste Management and the solid waste industry. She is the SWANA International Board representative for the Landfill Gas and Biogas Technical Division. She also served as Past Director/Director of the Landfill Gas Technical Division and has served as Vice Chair of the LFG Divisionâ€™s Rules and Regulations Committee. She has a Bachelorâ€™s degree in geology from Hope College in Holland, Michigan.

Title: Manager - Air Compliance
Description: BIO: Niki Wuestenberg has more than 20 years of experience in the solid waste industry, including air quality program management, project management, compliance training, environmental auditing, oversight of landfill gas collection system operations and maintenance and coordinating climate change initiatives She is the corporate air compliance manager of Republic Services. In this role, she has a broad range of air compliance responsibilities including review of regulations, air compliance evaluations, PSD/NSR guidance and compliance support, as well as oversight of state and federal Title V permit programs, New Source Performance Standards, and the National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants. As climate change has become increasingly more demanding, she also has focused on greenhouse gas initiatives and assisting with coordinating regulatory advocacy involving the solid waste industry. Niki joined Republic in 2001 as a technical resource to Republic facilities and personnel nationwide. Niki has served as Chair of SWANAâ€™s Rules and Regulations Committee for the Landfill Gas and Biogas Technical Division, represents Republic on the Solid Waste Industry for Climate Solutions Coalition, is an advisor to The Climate Registry and is a member of NSWMAâ€™s Climate Task Force.

Title: Principal
Description: BIO: Ivan Cooper is the national water resources and wastewater practice leader for Civil and Environmental Consultants, Inc. He has designed more than 100 leachate, industrial and municipal wastewater treatment plants and oversees projects in wastewater reuse, wastewater permitting and treatability. He is a graduate of Union College and has a Masterâ€™s degree in civil engineering from Northwestern University. He is a P.E. in 13 states and is a Board Certified Environmental Engineer from the American Academy of Environmental Engineers with a wastewater treatment specialty. He is the Chair of SWANAâ€™s Leachate Management Committee.

Title: Vice President
Description: BIO: Jeffrey Reed serves as SCS Engineersâ€™ national expert on landfill design and construction quality assurance. He has more than 28 years of engineering experience, having focused primarily on the design and permitting of landfills, including cell design projects. He has managed or directed more than 200 landfill design and permitting projects across the U.S. His areas of expertise have included storm water management, erosion control, hydrogeologic/hydraulic analysis, landfill design, landfill permitting, geosynthetic lining and cover systems, landfill leachate control and construction quality assurance. He has served as professional of record on more than 50 landfill liner and final cover CQA projects. He has prepared more than 40 landfill liner construction plans and contractor bid packages. Jeffrey has presented expert testimony in support of landfill permit applications. He has owned and managed engineering offices. He has lead design teams, as well as multi disciplinary teams, on small and large solid waste projects. Jeffrey graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in civil engineering from the University of Illinois. He is a member of SWANA and ASCE and is a registered professional engineer in 10 states.

Title: Director of Engineering and Compliance
Description: BIO: Marcos Elizondo is the region director of landfill operations and engineering for WCA Waste Corporation. Marcos has more than 22 years of experience in the solid waste industry and prior positions include region director of engineering, area engineer, district manager, district engineer, general manager and division engineer. During his career he has worked in the operations of landfills with waste intakes from 350 tons-per-day to 6,000 tons-per-day and has performed engineering work in design, permitting, construction and operation of landfills, transfer stations and recycling facilities. During his career, Marcos has done work at more than 90 landfills involving solid waste projects and operations in Texas, Louisiana, Arkansas, Tennessee, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, and Florida, as well as Mexico, Central America, South America and the Caribbean. Prior to working for WCA, Marcos worked for SCS Engineers, Republic Services and Waste Management. Marcos received his degree in civil engineering from the University of Texas at San Antonio in 1992 and has degree work on a Masterâ€™s in management from the same university.

Title: Bees Ferry Facilities Manager
Description: BIO: Harvey Gibson has been the Charleston County MRF supervisor from 2005-2010 and has served as the compost operation manager from 2010 to 2015 He is currently the manager of the Bees Ferry Facility, which includes the composting and landfill divisions. He is a member of the U.S. Composting Council and Palmetto Chapter of SWANA. Harvey served a four-year machinist apprenticeship and earned a degree from Purdue University. While compost superintendent, his division received the Carolina Recycling Associationâ€™s Outstanding Composting Recycling Award for 2011 and the USCCâ€™s â€œComposter of the Yearâ€ù award for 2014. The Bees Ferry facility produces STA certified compost and has been authorized for use in organic gardening through Clemson University. The facility at Bees Ferry handles more than 70,000 tons of yard waste and 4,000 tons of food waste annually.

Title: CEO
Description: BIO: James R. Miller has been a leading design professional and technical advisor in the solid waste management industry for more than 29 years. His work demonstrates a focus on integrating process and non-process requirements with overall plant layout and site configuration. He brings a wealth of expertise in designing facilities to maximize functionality and efficiency and to minimize life-cycle costs. Jim has been a frequent contributor at WASTECON, WasteExpo and a number of SWANA regional events. He also is guest lecturer for the Solid Waste Extension Program at UCLA on the subject of the history and design of solid waste facilities.

Title: Sales and Marketing Manager
Description: BIO: Victoria Leung is the manager of marketing and sales at Enterra Feed Corporation, a sustainable farming operation in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, that grows insects as a sustainable source of protein for the animal feed industry. The insects feed on pre-consumer food waste, upcycling the valuable nutrients in the waste into high quality end products. Victoria connects with local farmers, food processors and waste haulers to divert food waste to Enterraâ€™s commercial-scale facility, which has the capacity to process 100 tonnes of organics every day. She also oversees the sales of Enterraâ€™s insect-based products, working with feed manufacturers around the world who are searching for a sustainable alternative to traditional protein sources. Victoria graduated from the University of British Columbiaâ€™s Sauder School of Business in 2007 with a Bachelor of Commerce degree in marketing. She gained sales experience in the consumer packaged goods and telecommunications industries before joining the Enterra team in 2014. She is passionate about global food security and closing the loop on food waste, now exploring opportunities to expand Enterraâ€™s operations in North America and the rest of the world.

Title: Mark McDannel
Description: BIO: Mark McDannel is a supervising engineer in the Energy Recovery Engineering Section at the Los Angeles County Sanitation Districts. The Districts operate nine renewable power plants, six landfills and 12 wastewater treatment plants. The Energy Recovery Engineering Section is responsible for development of renewable energy projects, purchase and sale of electricity, energy efficiency, energy-related regulatory affairs and power plant site engineering. Mark has 35 years of experience in energy, air quality and combustion. He holds a Master of Science degree from the University of California Irvine Combustion Laboratory, and he is a licensed Mechanical Engineer and a Board Certified Environmental Engineer.

Title: Senior VP - Energy
Description: BIO: Brandon Moffatt is Harvest Powerâ€™s senior vice president of energy. Brandon has extensive management and technical experience in the environmental, waste and renewable energy sectors. He leads the companyâ€™s energy group, responsible for future project development, engineering design, feedstock procurement and technical support of complex organics processing and anaerobic digestion sites across North America. Also Brandon is responsible for the companyâ€™s energy gardens in Orlando, Florida, and London, Ontario. Brandon has an MBA from the Odette School of Business and holds a Bachelor of Science degree in environmental engineering from the University of Waterloo.

Title: CEO
Description: BIO: Eric Herbert has nearly 20 years of senior executive leadership experience in the solid waste industry and more than 10 years of experience in the engineering and construction industry. He has led two large regional waste companies as president or chief operating officer. His solid waste experience includes all elements of the business from acquisitions and competitive proposals, collection and hauling operations, recyclables processing including single stream and mixed waste, composting and landfill operations. He also rose to the senior level in the engineering and construction industry. He is a Registered Civil Engineer and Licensed General Engineering Contractor in California. Eric has used this technical and managerial background to develop and operate some of the largest solid waste and recyclables processing facilities in the nation. He brings an excellent knowledge of the industryâ€™s metrics and unique ability to design, build and operate innovative facilities. He is a demonstrated leader of complex business development ideas with a practical knowledge and approach.

Title: Ph.D.
Company: EPA Office of Research and Development
Description: BIO: Thabet Tolaymat has worked for the U.S. EPA Office of Research and Development in Cincinnati, Ohio, since 2003. Currently, he leads EPAâ€™s national research program in the area of solid waste research. His main research areas are solid waste management, bioreactor landfills, waste containment performance, construction and demolition waste landfills, fate and transport of environmental pollutants. Thabet is a member of the ITRC Alternative Landfill Technology team. He earned a Ph.D. in environmental engineering from the University of Florida in 2003.

Title: Director of Applied Research
Description: BIO: Jeremy O'Brien is a solid waste management consultant who has more than 25 years of experience in the industry. Since February 1999, he has served as the director of applied research for SWANA and has continued to provide consulting services to local governments as an independent solid waste management consultant. From 1979-1989, Jeremy was employed by HDR Engineering, Inc. He served as HDRâ€™s recycling technical director in 1991-1992 and was recognized as a â€œSenior Professional Associateâ€ù of the firm in 1998. While at HDR, he was a project manager in the companyâ€™s environmental and resource management group. From 1979-1989, Jeremy worked for Public Technology Institute, a local government research organization which serves as the technical arm of the National League of Cities and the International City Management Association. He began his career by serving as a research associate at the National Center For Resource Recovery in Washington, D.C. Jeremy received a Masterâ€™s degree from Duke University in urban and environmental engineering in 1978, as well as a Bachelorâ€™s degree in liberal arts from Duke University in 1974. Jeremy obtained his Professional Engineering registration and license in 1984.

Title: Senior Vice President
Description: BIO: Robert Gardner holds B.S. and M.E. degrees in civil engineering. He is a senior vice president of SCS Engineers. He serves on the firmâ€™s Board of Directors and oversees SCSâ€™s nation-wide solid waste management practice. His expertise is in solid waste management and environmental engineering. Bob is a past director of SWANAâ€™s Landfill Management Division. He currently is a member of SWANAâ€™s Applied Research Foundation and the Environmental Research and Education Foundation Research Council. He has provided engineering, permitting, construction and litigation support services to many municipal and private solid waste clients throughout the United States and elsewhere since 1980.

Title: CEO
Description: BIO: MaryEllen Etienne provides ongoing input into the industryâ€™s development, and helps businesses, municipalities and others incorporate robust reuse policies and strategies into their sustainability efforts. She regularly speaks about reuse and its triple bottom line benefits, and recently helped develop a national standard for sustainable resource management training programs as well as the first certification for zero waste facilities and professionals. MaryEllen is the CEO of Reuse Institute and the creator and producer of ReuseConex. She is also the founder of Reuse Alliance and co-founder of Creative Reuse Association and REUSE.International. She has worked with several other notable reuse and recycling organizations. She received her degree from the State University of New York at New Paltz, is on the board of directors of Association of Ohio Recyclers, Reuse Institute and SCRAP USA, and the advisory boards of National Recycling Coalition and US Zero Waste Business Council.

Title: Executive Director
Description: BIO: Peggy Ratcliffe is the founder of Live Thrive, an Atlanta-based nonprofit organization that empowers people, organizations, communities and businesses to make positive, healthy and sustainable changes to the environment. Peggy also was the founder and CEO of LivingGreenPages.com, an Internet resource providing information and access to more than 200 organic, sustainable and environmentally responsible businesses, services and products for individuals seeking to change their daily lifestyle choices and create a positive impact on Atlanta's environment. Peggy has a Bachelorâ€™s degree in education from Georgia State University.

Title: Outreach and Education Coordinator
Company: NCDEQ - Division of Environmental Assistance & Customer Service
Description: BIO: Heather Cashwell works with communities, businesses and non-profits on public outreach strategies aimed at increasing recycling and reuse, decreasing contamination and creating a waste reduction ethic. Previously, Heather worked for the Town of Cary, North Carolina, on recycling, reuse and community involvement programs. Heather is a former Board member of the Carolina Recycling Association and The Scrap Exchange, a premier reuse organization in North Carolina.

Title: Director of BioEnergy
Description: BIO: Gus Simmons is vice president and director of bioenergy for Cavanaugh, consulting the public and private sectors to improve water efficiency and bioenergy system deployment. Gus is a passionate advocate for the beneficial reuse of water, nutrients and carbon associated with organic waste streams using innovative approaches that cultivate better stewardship of these resources. His efforts in harvesting energy and valuable co-products from organic wastes span globally in the agricultural, food processing, industrial and municipal sectors. Gus has a Bachelor of Science degree in biological and agricultural engineering from North Carolina State University, with a concentration in biological waste treatment.

Title: Managing Director
Description: BIO: Bill Jorgenson has been managing partner of AGE and BGE (farm age digesters) since formed in 2008 under his leadership. These entities merged in June 2015 into Vanguard Renewables, which raised capital and debt through a group of large family offices to build and operate farm digesters in the U.S. Prior to total dedication to the digester industry, he ran a strategic management-consulting group that he founded in 1993 called SJH; the firm was dedicated to the global food, renewable ag fuel and agriculture industries. His first renewable projects were ethanol, and then progressed to bio-diesel, cellulosic and digesters over the years for a variety of global clients. Prior to forming SJH and Company, he was a vice president/director of the Quaker Oats Company, running Latin America, then chief operating officer for a leveraged buy-out company, the Terson Company (subsequently sold to NestlÃ©). He started his career working in international marketing for Colgate-Palmolive. In 2000, Bill launched eFarm, which licensed the patented technology he wrote to Deere & Company, becoming part of John Deere Agri Services. At John Deere, Bill was the senior managing director and provided services and technology solutions to connect the food supply chain, showing new ways to enhance value while tracking and tracing raw materials. He graduated from Colgate University and attended the University of Oslo, Norway. He is an author, industry speaker and Board of Advisor member with two new clean energy funds â€“ one in Canada and one in Switzerland.

Title: Partner
Description:
BIO: Ted Michaels is a Partner at AJW, Inc. and has nearly 20 years of experience in federal and state government affairs during which time he has served elected officials, trade associations, and companies with a focus on energy and environmental issues. He has earned a reputation for solving difficult policy challenges, based on developing practical solutions that achieve bipartisan support. His work has focused on crafting policies to drive investment in technologies and real property in order to solve complex environmental and energy related problems.

Since 2005, Mr. Michaels has served as President of the Energy Recovery Council (ERC), the national trade association representing the companies and communities engaged in the waste-to-energy sector. He is principally responsible for the legislative, regulatory, research, and public education efforts of the trade association. Through his work with ERC, he focuses on creating an environment in which the waste-to-energy sector can thrive. In addition, he serves as Chairman of the North American Waste-to-Energy Conference Steering Committee. Mr. Michaels is recognized as a national leader on waste-to-energy issues and often speaks at conferences across the country on the latest policies, trends, and developments in the sector.

Prior to joining ERC, Mr. Michaels served as the Staff Director of the Senate Environment and Public Works Subcommittee on Superfund and Waste Management, under the chairmanship of Senator Lincoln D. Chafee of Rhode Island. In this capacity, Mr. Michaels worked extensively on the Small Business Liability Relief and Brownfields Revitalization Act, which was signed into law on January 11, 2002. This law unleashed private sector investment in blighted properties that were previously unable to be redeveloped due to liability risk and funding limitations. In addition, Mr. Michaels had significant involvement in the reauthorization of the underground storage tank program, which was enacted as part of the Energy Policy Act of 2005, as well as many other pieces of proposed and enacted legislation under the jurisdiction of the Environment and Public Works Committee.

Earlier in his career, Mr. Michaels served as a Policy Analyst at the National Governorsâ€™ Association (NGA). Working in the NGA Natural Resources Group, he assisted in the development of policy positions adopted by the nationâ€™s Governors and advocated on behalf of those positions. Mr. Michaels received a Master of Arts in American History from Fordham University and a Bachelor of Arts in History from Providence College.
Â

Title: Sales Engineer
Description:
BIO: Allison Yeckel is a graduate from both the University of Pittsburgh and Chatham College, earning Bachelor of Science degrees in mechanical engineering and mathematics. Her 13 years of work experience includes engineering and business development positions with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Northrop Grumman and Johnson Controls. Currently, she is a sales engineer as part of the business development team of Alter NRG Corp. Alter NRG is a plasma gasification waste-to-energy company, with a mission to convert the worldâ€™s waste into high value-chain products. She is an active member in SWANA, where she serves as the Safety Ambassador for the Pennsylvania Keystone Chapter; she participates in Engineers Without Boarders, community litter clean-ups and volunteers at the local animal humane society.
Â

Title: Executive Director/CEO
Company: Solid Waste Authority of Palm Beach County Florida
Description:
BIO: Mark Hammond has 40 years of experience in planning, design, construction and operation of integrated solid waste management systems. He has been with the Solid Waste Authority since 1983 and served as COO, managing director and now as executive director/CEO. During his tenure, the Authority built an integrated solid waste management system consisting of six transfer stations, recovered materials processing facility, household hazardous waste drop-off facilities, in-vessel composting facility, ferrous processing facility, 2,000 ton-per-day RDF waste-to-energy facility and landfill. The Authority serves a population of 1.4 million residents and manages more than two million tons of solid waste per year. Mark Hammond is a SWANA member who served as International President from 1999-2000. He now serves on the Solid Waste Management Training Committee for the State of Florida. He also served on the Technical Advisory Group appointed by the State of Florida Department of Environment Protection to develop sanitary landfill design criteria.
Â

Title: P.E. / Landfill Gas Engineer
Description: BIO: Ms. Burkhardt is a Landfill Gas Engineer at the Delaware Solid Waste Authority (DSWA). She is responsible for air quality permit compliance for the Central (CSWMC) and Southern (SSWMC) Solid Waste Management Centers, management of long term landfill gas (LFG) beneficial use contracts, and management of various LFG construction projects. She serves as the YP Representative for SWANAâ€™s Landfill Gas and Biogas Technical Division. She also serves on the Examining Committee for the Delaware Association of Professional Engineers (DAPE). Ms. Burkhardt holds a Bachelor of Environmental Engineering degree and a Master of Civil Engineering degree from the University of Delaware.

Title: Director of Solid Waste
Description: BIO: Mark Schlievert is originally from Iowa, where he joined the U.S. Army Engineers, serving for 13 years as a combat engineer and construction diver. Mark has an Associateâ€™s degree in construction technology from Iowa Central Community College and a Bachelor of Science degree from the University of Iowa, where he majored in engineering geology with a minor in English. Mark has more than 44 years of construction experience and more than 20 years in the solid waste industry.

Title: Vice President - Technical Marketing
Description: BIO: Chris Eichelberger's role includes oversight of the companyâ€™s complete geosynthetics product line, including management of the unique ClosureTurf system, which uses Agru structured membrane products in conjunction with product technology from Watershed Geosynthetics to provide engineered synthetic turf closure solutions for impoundments and landfills. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Pennsylvania State University and has more than 14 years of experience in the geosynthetics industry including; divisional management, business development, contract administration, project management, constructability reviews, installation of products, specification and material selection and field experience in CQA of soils and geosynthetic materials. Chris serves the Board of Directors for the International Association of Geosynthetic Installers (IAGI) and has worked with large environmental construction and geotechnical engineering firms.

Title: Environmental Engineer - Department of Health and Environmental Control
Company: Bureau of Land and Waste Management
Description: COMING SOON

Title: Director
Description:
BIO: Dr. Sahadat Hossain is a professor of civil engineering at the University of Texas at Arlington and director of the Sustainable Management of Resources: Research and Training (SMAR2T) Center.Â 
Dr. Hossain has more than 15 Â years of professional and research experience in different aspects of sustainable waste management. The major objective of his research is to develop and test innovative, cost-effective and sustainable technologies for sustainable solid waste management systems, including enhanced leachate recirculation (bioreactor) landfill technology, landfill to gas to energy, use of waste materials for sustainable and reusable construction materials and landfill mining. Recently, Dr. Hossain completed a project with the City of Denton to study efficiency of leachate recirculation system in an enhanced leachate recirculation (ELR) or bioreactor landfill. This was the first bioreactor landfill project in Texas. Dr. Hossain had successfully utilized resistivity imaging Â  methods to monitor moisture movement within the landfill solid waste during the bioreactor landfill operation. Based on his results, he has proposed an innovative method of determining moisture content within landfilled solid waste without drilling or destructive testing. This is first proposed method of this kind in the U.S. and will have significant effect on the future landfill operation and management practices. Dr. Hossain also is working with other cities in Texas and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to study the feasibility of a landfill gas to energy project in Ghana.Â 
Dr. Hossain has completed his B.S. degree in civil engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, India; a Master of Engineering in Geotechnical Engineering from the Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), Bangkok, Thailand; and his Ph.D. from North Carolina State University at Raleigh, North Carolina.

Title: Director International Business Development
Description: BIO: Paul Oostelbos is director of international business development of Shanks. He has worked more than 25 years within the environmental and recycling industry. Starting as a process engineer/project manager, he developed into a multidisciplinary generalist well aware of all aspects to successfully run a project and business. At Shanks Municipal/Orgaworld, he is responsible for all aspects of growth and development of the company into new markets, especially Canada and the United States of America, as seen with the development of the London, Ottawa and Surrey facilities. He led Shanksâ€™ successful bid for the Surrey Biofuel Facility Project: a P3-project with the City of Surrey for the design, build, operation and maintenance of a 115,000-tpy organic waste procesÂ¬sing facility that combines biocel dry anaerobic digestion with Orgaworldâ€™s robust tunnel composting technology.

Title: Director of Operations & General Counsel
Description: BIO: David Cox is director of operations, general counsel, and a co-founder of the Coalition for Renewable Natural Gas. Under the leadership of Mr. Cox and executive director Johannes Escudero, the RNG Coalition has grown to a national and increasingly international force for the advancement of renewable natural gas. David is widely recognized for his leadership in law and policy, including securing RNGâ€™s place as the predominate source of cellulosic biofuel under the federal Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS2). David is an attorney and graduate of the University of the Pacificâ€™s McGeorge School of Law. He received his Bachelor of Arts degree from Westmont College. Prior to working for the RNG Coalition, he spent six years as staff in the California State Assembly, where he played an instrumental role in major energy, environmental and transportation policies. Â

Title: President
Description: BIO: Harrison Clay serves as president of Clean Energy subsidiary Clean Energy Renewable Fuels. Harrison is responsible for leading Clean Energyâ€™s efforts to produce and sell renewable natural gas (or biomethane) that is derived from the anaerobic decomposition of organic waste. He also serves on the Board of Managers for Clean Energyâ€™s landfill gas processing companies: Dallas Clean Energy McCommas Bluff and Canton Renewables. Prior to joining Clean Energy, Harrison served as director of corporate development and general counsel at the San Francisco investment bank WR Hambrecht & Co. He has extensive experience in corporate and project finance, mergers and acquisitions, corporate development, venture capital and the clean tech and energy industries. Harrison earned his law degree from the University of Virginia and a dual Bachelorâ€™s degree in anthropology and English from the University of Georgia.

Title: President
Description: BIO: Evan Williams is responsible for the structuring of Cambrianâ€™s energy projects. In doing so, Evan works with landfill owners and energy customers and their legal counsel to arrive at agreements that reflect a fair sharing of both responsibilities and benefits. These agreements must not only meet the financial expectations of the parties, but also must satisfy the requirements for a successful energy project development in the areas of regulatory compliance, permitting, tax law, real property title issues and financing. Evan received his Bachelor of Arts degree from UCLA in 1965. He received his Juris Doctor from UCLA in 1968. Evan is a principal in the law firm of Poindexter & DoutrÃ©, Inc., and a director of Glass Inc. International.

Title: Principal
Description: BIO: Ivan Cooper is the national water resources and wastewater practice leader for Civil and Environmental Consultants, Inc. He has designed more than 100 leachate, industrial and municipal wastewater treatment plants and oversees projects in wastewater reuse, wastewater permitting and treatability. He is a graduate of Union College and has a Masterâ€™s degree in civil engineering from Northwestern University. He is a P.E. in 13 states and is a Board Certified Environmental Engineer from the American Academy of Environmental Engineers with a wastewater treatment specialty. He is the Chair of SWANAâ€™s Leachate Management Committee.

Title: Project Director
Description: BIO: Marc Rogoff is a nationally recognized expert in the financial modeling of solid waste management systems. With more than 30 years of experience in solid waste management as a public agency manager and consultant, he has managed more than 100 Pro Forma modeling and rate assessments throughout the U.S. on all facets of solid waste management. They include waste collection studies, facility feasibility assessments, asset valuations, transfer station versus long-haul transport evaluations, fleet management and vehicle acquisition planning, MRF contract assessment and operations, and waste conversion feasibility. Marc has directed independent engineerâ€™s feasibility reports for nearly two dozen major public works projects totaling more than $1.2 billion in project financings. His work has included development of detailed spreadsheet rate models establishing the financial feasibility of each projects, long-term economic forecasts, cash flow and IRR analysis, cost of service, financial assurance, and projected rate impact upon project users and customers. He has written widely in the field and is the author of several noted textbooks covering the topics of financial forecasting and project feasibility.

Title: President
Description: BIO: Jim Seley is the managing member and president of Feed Commodities, LLC (est. 1996), a recycling company located in the Pacific Northwest that converts food by-products into feed ingredients for use in the poultry and dairy industries. Inspired to capture real-time data and improved waste stream tracking, Jim founded Normandy Waste Management Systems in 2011. Normandy WMS provides food processors with tools and software required to identify waste sources, communicate objectives and ultimately reduce waste. Jim received his Bachelorâ€™s degree from the College of the Holy Cross in Worcester, Massachusetts, and his MBA from the University of Washington. In addition to coaching local youth sports, Jim is a contributing board member on the Tacoma-Pierce County Business Alliance Political Action Committee and the Pointe du Hoc Foundation. Jimâ€™s exemplary leadership and innovative approach were recognized in 2015, when Feed Commodities received the Tacoma-Pierce County Chamber of Commerce Spotlight! Medium Business Award.

Title: Executive Director
Description: BIO: Will Sagar is executive director with the Southeast Recycling Development Council. He works from his home town of Brevard, North Carolina. Will graduated from the University of North Carolina with a double major in economics and mathematics. After selling the excavation business he built and operated for a decade, he was the solid waste director for Transylvania County, North Carolina, for 16 years. While there he started the recycling program, built the first lined landfill in Western North Carolina; implemented a Pay As You Throw program; established a permanent household hazardous waste collection; and started an electronics recycling program. Later with Henderson County, he started electronics collection and created a county energy accounting system. Will is a past president of the Board of Directors of the Carolina Recycling Association. For several years, he also chaired the Board of the Free Clinic of Transylvania County, which serves the medical needs of the uninsured.

Title: Director - Resource Conservation and Sustainability Division
Description:
BIO: Cheryl Coleman is the Director for the Resource Conservation and Sustainability Division (RCSD) within the Office or Resource Conservation and Recovery at the US EPA. The Resource Conservation and Sustainability Division (RCSD) is responsible for: promoting the reduction, reuse, recovery and recycling of municipal, industrial and extractive wastes and the long term sustainable management of these materials; establishing collaborative partnerships with businesses and State, territorial, and local governments; and, developing policy, technical guidance, tools, and public information on sustainable materials management.
Ms. Coleman is a graduate of Hampton University in Hampton, VA. She did further graduate work at Rutgers University, Piscataway, NJ, and earned a Masterâ€™s degree in Biology from the University of South Carolina, Columbia, SC. Ms. Coleman has over thirty years of experience with materials/waste management. She came to US EPA Headquarters from the SC Department of Health and Environmental Control where she was the Director of Compliance and Enforcement for waste programs and mining. Additionally, she served in several leadership capacities for the Association of State and Territorial Solid Waste Management Officials (ASTSWMO).

Title: Senior Account Manager - Retail Product Sourcing
Description: BIO: Amy Kosar has worked in food banking for 10 years. She was the food sourcing manager at the Lowcountry Food Bank in Charleston, South Carolina, until she joined the Feeding America team in July of 2015. She works with food banks in seven southern states and grocery partners including Publix, Southeastern Grocers and H-E-B to help manage and facilitate their store donation programs.

Title: Vice President
Description: BIO: Dr. Dillah received his Bachelor of Science degree. in electrical engineering from the University of Florida, his Master of Science degree in environmental engineering from New York University Polytechnic School of Engineering (NYU-Poly), and his Ph.D. in civil engineering ,also from NYU-Poly. He is a registered professional engineer and Board Certified Environmental Engineer. Dr. Dillah is a vice president of SCS Engineers and heads up its landfill gas/engineering group in the Reston, Virginia, office. He has 25 years of experience in the environmental engineering field.

Title: Engineer
Company: Fairfax County Department of Public Works and Environmental Services
Description: BIO: Chris Meoli received his Bachelor of Science degree in environmental engineering from Florida Institute of Technology. He is a registered professional engineer in Virginia and is a licensed Virginia Class II Waste Management Facility Operator. Chris has more than 20 years of experience in environmental compliance and engineering. He is an engineer with the County of Fairfax in the Department of Public Works and Environmental Services, Solid Waste Management Program. He spent 7.5 years at the Fairfax County I-95 Landfill overseeing technical staff and contractors, where he was responsible for the management of the LFG, leachate and storm water system systems and for overall environmental compliance. He also helped to support the planning, design and operation of the ash monofill at the Landfill. Previously, he worked for nine years in air permitting and compliance with the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality in the Northern Virginia office.

Title: Principal Engineer
Description: BIO: Jospeh Curro is a principal engineer and the landfill gas discipline leader and senior solid waste engineer with CDM in Boston, Massachusetts. He has more than 45 years of experience in solid waste projects, concentrating on waste combustion, landfill gas system design and field operations. He has served as the lead design engineer for many landfill gas extraction, compression, flaring and transmission systems. He has written and presented many papers at various national and regional SWANA conferences.

Title: Sales Engineer
Description: BIO: Eric Wilgenbusch has a Bachelor of Science degree in electro-mechanical engineering from Loras College in Dubuque, Iowa, and is the Eastern region sales and application engineer for Unison Solutions, Inc. For the past 10 years, Eric has been involved in all facets of biogas to energy and biogas to vehicle fueling systems engineered and manufactured by Unison Solutions. Ericâ€™s knowledge of biogas conditioning technology is unsurpassed in this industry, and he truly enjoys helping customers make the most from their biogas.

Title: Project Manager
Description: BIO: Jeff Friesen is a professional mechanical engineer and founding member of ENERGYneering Solutions, Inc. (ESI). He has eight years of experience in the landfill gas industry and has been involved in development, design and construction of more than 25 diverse renewable energy projects. Jeffâ€™s experience includes: landfill and digester gas collection and control, landfill gas-to-energy, renewable natural gas conversion of biofuels, biofuel cleanup systems, woody biomass thermal energy and hydroelectricity. In 2011, Jeff and his wife Jenna moved to very rural western Tanzania, Africa, to design and install a small hydroelectric turbine at a school.

Title: Project Engineer
Description: BIO: Daniel Waineo works for ES Engineering Services and has been designing landfill gas to energy systems for 20 years. He has designed regenerale siloxane removal systems, iron chelate and media based H2S treatment systems, IC engine facilities, High BTU facilities, boiler facilities, compressor stations, dehydration treatment systems and turbine and microturbine facilities.

Title: Manager - Solid Waste Grants - Planning and Regulation Development
Company: Department of Health and Environmental Control
Description: BIO: Jana White has more than 20 years of experience in solid waste reduction and oversaw the 2014 revision of the S.C. compost regulation, R.61-107.4.

Title: Director of Operations
Description: BIO: Jeff Dworek has served as the director of operations at Metro Waste Authority in Des Moines, Iowa, since 1996. His operational focus supports the organizationâ€™s mission of â€œNo Wasted Resourcesâ€ù and ensures the agency position as a leader in safe, smart disposal and recycling options. As part of senior management, Jeff develops and implements the strategic plan and manages the operational and capital budgets. He has initiated many multi-million dollar projects, positively enhancing an integrated waste management system for Central Iowa. Jeff oversees operations at Metro Wasteâ€™s award-winning Metro Park East Landfill and Metro Central Transfer Station, as well as Metro Park West Landfill and Metro Compost Center. Recent achievements include implementing a new compaction method, which extends the life of the landfill by 17 years, and construction of a second transfer station. An alumnus of Penn State and the University of Iowa, Jeff holds a degree in aerospace engineering and an Executive MBA. He also holds several certifications in waste management. Jeff is a regular contributor to SWANA and NWRA. Since 2005, Jeff has served Iowa solid waste industry professionals as a Board member of the Iowa Society of Solid Waste Operations.

Title: Sr. Project Engineer
Description: BIO: Robert Curtis has more than 25 years of experience designing, permitting, managing, and overseeing construction of civil and environmental projects. He specializes in creating detailed designs for landfill development and closure, stormwater management and erosion control plans for landfill design and remedial action projects. Robert has extensive environmental experience, which includes design of slurry walls, design and oversight for relocation and treatment of contaminated soil, siting and installation of groundwater monitoring wells, and permitting and environmental compliance.

Title: Florida Waste Operations - Manager
Description: COMING SOON

Title: Landfill Operations Manager
Description: BIO: Larry Ruiz has more than 25 years of environmental project experience, including hands-on participation in field work, as well as design work for solid waste management projects. His responsibilities have included landfill siting and design, landfill operations, landfill closure plans, landfill leachate monitoring and treatment system design, landfill gas collection and control systems design, and solid waste facilities environmental assessments. In addition, Larry has extensive solid waste management presentation experience.

Title: Project Manager
Description: BIO: J Morgan is a project manager with SCS Engineers and works out of the Charlotte, North Carolina, office. He received his Bachelor of Science degree in chemical engineering from Clemson University and is a Licensed Professional Engineer in multiple states, including South Carolina. He received his MBA from Winthrop University in 2005. He is active in the South Carolina chapter of SWANA and serves on the local board. J Morgan has more than 10 years experience as an engineer in compliance, design and investigations for landfill and landfill gas, environmental compliance and site assessment projects with SCS His project experience includes more than 30 landfills in the Unites States and abroad. His experience with compliance includes applying for and obtaining local and federal permits along with preparing reports to comply with Title V permits, NSPS regulations, NESHAP regulations and MACT regulations, to name a few. J Morgan works with clients and regulators in multiple states to ensure the sites he works on are in compliance with local and federal regulations. His assessment experience includes onsite assessment, along with data and documentation review. He works with developers, private firms and municipalities to improve landfill gas collection and usage.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Description: BIO: Chuck Smith, P.E., iis a senior member of CH2Mâ€™s Integrated Waste Solutions (IWS) practice within the Environment and Nuclear Business Group. He is a professional engineer registered in Alberta and British Columbia, with more than 20 years of hands-on experience in the solid waste industry. Throughout his career, Chuck has provided project management and technical direction to many municipal clients in the areas of waste planning, waste diversion strategies, landfill permitting and approvals, landfill design and closure, waste management facility infrastructure planning, landfill gas (LFG) control and utilization, greenhouse gas (GHG) emission management and leachate management. Chuck also is responsible for business development within the Canadian Prairie region.

Title: Landfill Operations Team Leader - Waste & Recycling Services
Description: BIO: Martin Ortiz is a hydrogeologist with 16 years of professional experience. Before joining the City of Calgary and Waste and Recycling Services (WRS) in 2005, Martin worked in his native Colombia in the oil and gas sector. He joined WRS as a project hydrogeologist to work on groundwater monitoring, environmental database management, compliance reporting and remediation projects. In 2010, he moved into environmental control leader position, leading regulatory compliance, LFG operations, leachate treatment, closure and post-closure care, remediation projects and other related management duties. In 2015, he accepted the opportunity to lead the landfill operations group; he has been working closely with the landfill superintendents and other members of the landfill operations group on organizational realignment and on improving delivery of programs and services at the three City-owned waste management facilities.

Title: Manager of Environmental Services
Description: BIO: David Kerr is the manager of environmental services for the City of Kawartha Lakes. He is responsible for operation, regulatory compliance and delivery of waste management, and water and wastewater services. The City of Kawartha Lakes oversees five active and 12 closed landfills David is a Professional Geoscientist with more than 30 years of experience in the waste management industry, having worked at the municipal and provincial government levels and private consulting. Many of the projectswith which he has been involved have required innovation, appreciation of natural processes and evaluation of complex engineering solutions.

Title: Project Engineering Manager
Description: BIO: Denise Burgess is an Ontario Professional Engineer and received her Bachelorâ€™s degree in cvil engineering from the University of Waterloo She has been practising in the environmental field for more than 17 years and been involved in more than 30 landfill gas related projects in Canada. She is responsible for all design and approvals related work. She has extensive experience in the approval, design, construction and monitoring and maintenance of landfill gas flaring and utilization systems, as well as in-depth knowledge of the Canadian Landfill Gas Code and how it is adopted in various provinces including Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Ontario and Newfoundland and Labrador.

Title: Attorney at Law
Description: BIO: Barry Shanoff received his undergraduate and law degrees from Northwestern University. His clients include local governments and waste authorities throughout the country. Since 1982, he has served as general counsel for the Solid Waste Association of North America. Barry has negotiated and written contracts covering put-or-pay arrangements, hauling franchises, privatized landfill operations and management, waste-to-energy projects and landfill gas utilization. As a recognized expert in flow control, he has for many years worked with local officials nationwide in planning and implementing waste facility designation programs. His extensive writing on solid waste issues includes an award-winning legal column that ran for two decades in World Wastes magazine. Since 1999, he has been the Legal Editor of Waste Age magazine (now Waste 360) where his column appears each month. His professional affiliations include membership in the International Municipal Lawyers Association. He is licensed in Illinois, Maryland and the District of Columbia and has qualified to practice in a number of federal district and appeals courts and before the U.S. Supreme Court.

Title: Regional Operations Director
Description: BIO: Mark Hill is an operations director for DTE Biomass Energy and has been with the company for more than 10 years. He oversees seven landfill gas to energy projects including power generation, direct use and high-BTU (renewable natural gas). In this role, he is responsible for safety, daily operations, contract negotiations, wellfield management and personnel management. Mark has been heavily involved in continuous improvement projects for the CAT 3520 fleet, best wellfield management practices and building DTE Biomass Energyâ€™s safety culture. Prior to joining DTE Biomass Energy, Mark was a Cavalry Troop Commander during Operation Iraqi Freedom, leading 80 soldiers conducting convoy escort missions. Additionally, Mark has worked as an analyst in the cement and coal industries. Mark has a Bachelor of Arts degree in economics from Dartmouth College and a Masterâ€™s degree in business administration from the Ross School of Business at the University of Michigan.

Title: Senior Client Manager
Description: BIO: Steven Wittmann has more than 40 years of experience in the environmental investigation, engineering and construction field. Along with his extensive consulting experience, he was a past owner and president of a design-build environmental construction company. His experience includes investigating, permitting and construction of landfill gas control and energy recovery projects. He has managed six biogas to compressed natural gas (CNG) vehicle fuel projects, along with electrical generation projects.

Title: Project & Product Manager
Description: BIO: Russ Keckler is responsible for the flare and evaporator product lines with LFG Specialties, including P&L. He also serves as a functional lead for the design group. He has more than 10 years of experience in the solid waste industry and has managed numerous landfill gas beneficial use projects.

Title: Vice President and Director of Capital Projects
Description: BIO: David Pepper holds a Bachelor of Science degree in professional geology from Lousiana University. He has more than 28 years of experience in the solid waste industry working primarily in the areas of landfill development and operations. David serves as vice chair of the Carolinas Chapter of National Waste & Recycling Association (NWRA), and is a member of Legislative Sub-Committee of NWRA Carolinas Chapter, and an EFEF Council member. David holds a SWANA certfication as a Manager of Landfill Operations and also a South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control "Landfill Manager".

Title: Senior Environmental Policy Specialist
Description: BIO: Veronica Roof leads procurement projects with an objective to facilitate partnerships and secure competitive solid waste and resource recovery services. She has been involved from the initial stages through development of the detailed procurement documentation and contract instruments and contract negotiations. Her experience spans the country including, but not limited to, projects completed for governmental entities in Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, Texas, Oklahoma, Arizona, Minnesota, California and Washington. She has authored a best management guide for recycling procurements and contracts. She is a licensed attorney in the State of Georgia and a member of the Environmental Law Section and Local Government Section of the State Bar of Georgia. Veronica brings more than a decade of experience assisting local, regional and federal governments with solid waste and resource recovery procurement issues, as well as planning, waste characterization and operational studies.

Title: General Manager
Description:
BIO:
Tim Flanagan has been in the recycling and solid waste field for more than 30 years. Timâ€™s public sector experience started with the award winning City of Palo Alto in its recycling and landfilling operations. He also worked for the County of Santa Clara in its Solid Waste Planning Department. Timâ€™s private sector experience spanned 17 years with Waste Management , Inc., serving as their Western Region director of recycling and as a eistrict manager for a variety of collection, recycling and transfer station operations covering northern and southern California. Tim is the general manager for the MRWMD and has oversight for all the district operations including the MRF recycling and composting operations, landfill gas-to-energy plant, equipment maintenance, HHW and Last Chance Mercantile, engineering and landfill site operations. Tim is a SWANA-certified MOLO Landfill Operator, and is the past director of the Recycling and Special Waste Technical Division. He is the Recycling and Special Waste Technical Division representative on the SWANA International Board. He is a director for the Gold Rush Chapter for SWANA and a former president of the Chapter. He is a Board member of Leadership Monterey Peninsula, a local community leadership and training program, and is a member of the Cannery Row Rotary club. Tim holds a Bachelor of Arts in public policy and economics from the University of California Santa Barbara.

Title: Vice-President
Description: BIO: Rob Hilton is a vice president with HF&H Consultants and the current president of the California Resource Recovery Association. With nearly 15 years of experience in consulting, he has worked with more than 110 government agencies through more than 300 projects with a focus on planning, design, procurement and financial structures of integrated waste management systems focused on reducing landfill disposal and increasing reuse, recycling, and composting. Rob is an active member of the Board of Directors of the California Resource Recovery Association and a member of the Institute of Management Consultants (IMC), American Management Association (AMA), as well as SWANA.

Title: President
Description: BIO: Mitch Kessler, president of Kessler Consulting, Inc. (KCI), has more than 30 years in the solid waste industry and has been responsible for more than 300 projects pertaining to comprehensive waste management, collection, recycling, and composting programs for municipalities, institutions, and private organizations. Mitch is a nationally recognized expert in the procurement and operations of solid waste collection systems and materials recovery programs and facilities and is especially knowledgeable in collection and market development issues as they relate to the economic viability of solid waste and recycling programs. Mitch has assisted many clients with developing strategic partnerships, publicâ€êpublic and publicâ€êprivate, to leverage capabilities. Mitch is the president of the SWANA Florida Sunshine Chapter and earned the prestigious Professional Achievement Award for the Private Sector in 2012. His firm was the prime contractor for developing the SWANA Manager of Recycling Systems certification course development team. Mitch brings extensive experience in public speaking and engaging audiences of various sizes, backgrounds, and demographics. Mitch earned his degree in environmental law from the University of New Hampshire and holds a Masterâ€™s degree in American studies and a Bachelorâ€™s of Science degree in management from Purdue University.

Title: Principal
Description: BIO: Henry Kerfoot has more than 30 years of experience in characterizing subsurface reactions and transport processes and has worked on elevated temperatures at landfills since 2006. In 2014, a major landfill firm turned to him for development of an evaluation of two cooling methods for waste with elevated temperatures, and that work is ongoing. He has developed analytical models for heat transport in waste to allow prediction of deeper temperatures from shallow temperature data and methods for evaluation of the performance of cooling methods. He recently completed design of an interception barrier to allow continued operation of a landfill that has elevated temperatures from exothermic reactions. In addition to heat transport, he has evaluated groundwater transport of contaminants and migration of landfill gas. He was the originator of the concept of landfill gas rather than leachate as the source of volatile organic compounds in groundwater and has obtained regulatory approval for natural attenuation of landfill gas impacts on groundwater in California and for groundwater contaminants ranging from coal ash constituents to uranium in various other states. He has worked on landfills in Australia and has obtained regulatory approval of natural attenuation of landfill gas migration in both the U.S. and Australia.

Title: Director
Description: BIO: Dr. Bryan Staley currently serves as president and CEO of the Environmental Research and Education Foundation (EREF), one of the largest sources of research and scholarships related to solid waste management. He joined the EREF in 2008, where he started as vice-president of environmental programs, and has 21 years of experience in the environmental engineering field. He is recognized nationally as technical expert in sustainable solid waste management issues and holds degrees from N.C. State University (PhD, B.S.) and the University of Tennessee (M.S.). In addition to his leadership responsibilities, Dr. Staley plays an active role in the Foundationâ€™s internal research program, where he provides thought leadership, oversight and data analysis. Dr. Staley is a licensed professional engineer has held key positions in consulting firms as a project manager and vice-president of engineering where he managed projects ranging from solid waste management, wastewater treatment system design, to retail/commercial land development and environmental management of large-scale livestock operations.

Title: Partner
Description: BIO: Michael D. Bedley graduated in 1986 from the Georgia Institute of Technology with a Bachelor of Science degree in mechanical engineering. In 1992, he graduated from the NOVA Southern University with a Master of Business Administration. Since 1982, he has been involved in the electric utility and power generation areas with more than 30 years of experience in the industry, which included various engineering, financial, managerial, and consulting specialist positions. Since 1995, his responsibilities at APEX Power Services Corp. have included providing consulting services to Fortune 500 companies. His current work with APEX includes negotiating PPA agreements, lender and other commercial/regulatory issues surrounding power production, renewable energy generation/development, providing state commission witness expertise regarding renewable energy portfolio standards, efficiency/energy recovery and financial balancing among stakeholders and electric energy production. Along with his involvement in APEX, he also acts as an on-air TV/radio expert and provides information and resources for CNBC, Nightly Business Report, The Associated Press, national trade publications, and several newspapers including the USA Today, Tribune, and Wall Street Journal in areas pertaining to electric utility deregulation, regulation and free market competition.

Title: LEED AP / Project Manager
Description: BIO: Ashley Evans is an Environmental Engineer with 12 years of solid waste consulting experience and recently graduated with an MBA. She is a member of the SWANA YP Steering Committee as well as the Membership Chair of the SWANA Mid-Atlantic Chapter.

Title: Chief Marketing Officer
Description: BIO: Randall N. Lack has been a successful entrepreneur within the emissions and alternative energy industry for almost a decade. In 2005, he co-founded Element Markets, LLC, a leading carbon management and alternative energy company, and currently serves as a chief marketing officer. Since founding Element Markets, Randall has assisted in the development of several alternative energy projects including wind, solar, landfill gas and biomass energy. He has extensive experience in structuring transactions spanning 17 emissions trading regions and covering seven emissions commodities. In addition, Randall has extensive experience in transacting renewable energy and carbon credits throughout North America. Randall is an acclaimed speaker and media resource for renewable energy credits, greenhouse gas trading, regional emission markets and pending emissions legislation. He has developed regional emissions, renewable energy, and greenhouse gas portfolios for a wide-range of clients, from municipalities to Fortune 500 corporations. He received his BBA degree, magna cum laude, from the University of Houston.

Title: Partner
Description: BIO: Rick Sapir started with the law firm of Hawkins, Delafield & Wood after graduating from Fordham Law School in 1986. Since then, he has focused his practice in the representation of local and state governments in solid waste, water, wastewater, biosolids, electricity, gas and transportation transactions. Rick has developed expertise in all legal and business issues surrounding environmental facilities, including their development, permitting, financing, procurement, construction and operations. In the solid waste sector, he has served as procurement counsel on several solid waste projects that have been constructed and are operating, including waste-to-energy projects, composting projects, landfills, material recovery facilities, baling facilities and landfill gas-to-energy projects. He received his Bachelorâ€™s degree from Union College in New York in 1983 before earning his law degree.

Title: CEO
Description: BIO: Andy Campanella is co-founder and CEO of Loci Contols, a company he started in 2012 while attending graduate school at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology with fellow Loci co-founder, Melinda Sims. Then, Andy was working on a Master's of Science degree in the system design and management program at MITâ€™s Sloan School, a program he finished in the summer of 2013. Since graduating from MIT, Andy has been working full time on commercializing Loci Controls' landfill gas optimization service. Prior to attending graduate school, Andy was the first engineer hired at the WiTricity Corporation, where he played a key role in the companyâ€™s early growth. Based on his work at WiTricity, Andy is listed as inventor on more than 50 US patents and applications related to control systems, power electronics and wireless power transfer. Prior to working at WiTricity, Andy was a hardware engineer at Teradyne, his first job after getting a Bachelor of Science degree in electrical engineering, also from MIT. Andy is an active member of SWANA and serves as Board member for SWANAâ€™s Southern New England Chapter.

Title: CEO
Description: BIO: Alain Castro is the chief executive officer of Ener-Core, Inc. He has spent the vast majority of his career developing, financing and building new power generation plants, as well as optimizing older energy infrastructure assets across many countries throughout Europe, Latin America and North America. Most recently, he was interim CEO of the North and South America divisions of Akuo Energy, a leading international developer/operator of renewable energy projects with over $1 billion in operational power plants. He also founded International Energy Ventures in 2002, which has invested capital and nurtured the growth of companies across the areas of fuel cells, batteries, wind energy and biofuels.

BIO: Robert B. Miller was an executive with several large mechanical contracting companies specializing in large commercial and Industrial projects worldwide. He then purchased his own mechanical contracting company, operating it successfully for 10 years. He founded a packaged cogeneration company using internal combustion engines to run on natural and biogas. This company was sold to Amerada Hess, and Robert ran that division for Hess for five years. In 2005, he cofounded Turbogenix, Inc., which developed a 125 kW waste heat generator. This company merged with Calnetix, Inc., and was sold to General Electric in 2011. In 2012, Robert founded Clear Power Systems, Inc., which was sold to Questor Technologies, Inc., in 2013. Questor is a Calgary-based manufacturer of incinerators and combustors. This company manufactures waste heat generators from SO kW to 500 kW. Robert serves as president of Clear Power Systems.
